question: Consider the nuclear fission reaction <katex>${}_{0}^{1}n+{}_{92}^{235}U \rightarrow {}_{56}^{144}Ba+{}_{36}^{89}Kr+3_{0}^{1}n$</katex>. Assuming all the kinetic energy is carried away by the fast neutrons only and total binding energies of <katex>${}_{92}^{235}U$</katex>, <katex>${}_{56}^{144}Ba$</katex> and <katex>${}_{36}^{89}Kr$</katex> to be 1800 MeV, 1200 MeV and 780 MeV respectively, the average kinetic energy carried by each fast neutron is (in MeV)
explanation: Q value = (Binding Energy of products) - (Binding Energy of reactants).
This energy is carried by 3 neutrons.
